description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4b4gi","text":"Quick and dirty microbial genome extraction protocol using Edwards buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmtfs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7ig9","text":"I've been using this method for in-lab Archaeal evolution study for the last four years or so and it's been working fantastically well, especially for short read sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rpic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1go3e","text":"Certain microbes (such as Deinococcus) can be difficult to process properly using just this protocol - standard caveats and fixes tend to improve the output, such as adding initial lysozyme incubation step in the very beginning, sometimes combined with a freeze-thaw cycle for especially difficult samples (I'll update and upload a separate version of this protocol for difficult microbes in the future).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f2fd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1hgd","text":"This particular protocol is aimed at getting as much intact, long-read capable DNA out from a microbe as cheaply as possible, as shown in the included gel picture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi8c2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hblo","text":"Originally written up for my lab note at https://naturepoker.wordpress.com/2023/02/26/halobacteria-mutant-sequencing-3-years-in/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":8},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":87}],"data":{}},{"key":"cp3if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dbml","text":"Ideation and initial testing performed with Sebastian S. Cocioba at Binomica Labs for ONT Deinococcus radiophilus genome sequencing project, using RAD004 rapid sequencing kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q8g6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr9gu","text":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_020889625.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":53}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7620C620097F11EE80286D600A4CFAA3","url":"https://naturepoker.wordpress.com"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"68890E90097F11EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://naturepoker.wordpress.com/2023/02/26/halobacteria-mutant-sequencing-3-years-in"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C094CC94097F11EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_020889625.1"}}}}
image_attribution: Image taken by author - Halobacterium mutant strain genome extraction

status.info: The protocol works and is currently being improved. Different microbes will require optimization.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajeco","text":"Spin down 1 ml of sample for 1 minute at max speed and decant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bd2hc","text":"Resuspend vigorously with 100ul Edward's buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8lla4","text":"Transfer carefully to PCR tube - mixture will be viscous","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ovob","text":"Add 2ul of RNase A and mix vigorously, vortex for 10 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6t414","text":"Incubate at 37C for 15 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"70b8r","text":"Add 2ul of Proteinase K and mix vigorously, vortex for 10 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amjao","text":"Incubate at 55C for 1 hour, and deactivate via incubation at 95C for 10 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bnvpg","text":"Transfer to 1.5ml eppendorf tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kufn","text":"Add 10% 3M (pH 5.4) sodium acetate, and 1:1 volume of 100% isopropyl alcohol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5c86f","text":"Invert tube 10 times - precipitates should begin to form","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1i3t0","text":"Spin down at max speed for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2rnum","text":"Decant the supernatant carefully","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e0mn3","text":"Add 1ml of 70% EtOH and resuspend the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4oe7h","text":"Spin down at max speed for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"engi7","text":"Repeat 70% EtOH resuspension and washing step at least 2 more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"atk0o","text":"Decant completely and dry the pellet for 5 minutes - do not let the pellet overdry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"db9ng","text":"Resuspend in storage buffer of choice or dH2O to wanted volume ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4meoi","text":"Incubate in a 37C shaker for 1 hour - the extract is likely to be not dissolved fully","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8e6gh","text":"Incubate in 4C overnight - depending on yield, the extract will be extremely viscous","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n7mr","text":"Check extraction quality using both standard gel electrophoresis and UV-Vis method such as Nanodrop. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
